Judul: EFFECTS OF COMPOUND ADDED WITH CO2 INJECTION IN LOWERING MINIMUM MISCIBILITY PRESSURE AT ���L��� FIELD
Abstrak:
CO2 injection is one of the most promising EOR technique and it is important to conduct the gas injection at
miscible condition to reach maximum recovery efficiency. But miscible injection is not applicable in some
fields in Indonesia due to high temperature that leads to high minimum miscibility pressure (MMP). This high
value of MMP sometimes also exceeds its fracture pressure make it impossible to be conducted.
This study focuses on lowering MMP in “L” Field by adding compounds along with CO2. This investigation
considers compounds from five functional groups which are alcohol, amine, ketone, aldehyde and ether with
range compound amount of 10%, 20% and 30% mole and the whole simulation to estimate MMP was run using
WINPROP 2015 by cell to cell method.
It is found that the more amount of compound added, the more MMP reduction will be achieved. The most
effective compound in lowering MMP in “L” field does not only depend on the type of compound, but also the
amount of compound added. At 10% mole, the most effective compound is propylamine which can reduce
MMP up to 20.15%. Meanwhile at 20% mole of compound, methanol, propylamine and diethyl ether reduce
MMP up to 31%. Methanol and Propylamine are the best effective compounds at 30% mole that give 42.6%
MMP reduction.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Prof. Ir. Asep Kurnia Permadi, M.Sc., Ph.D.
Kata Kunci: CO2 Injection, Miscible Injection, minimum miscibility pressure, alcohol, ketane, amine, aldehyde, ether
